wikipedia_page.main: (Robert) Timo Hannay (born 1968) is the founding Managing Director of School Dash Limited, an education technology company based in London.  Prior to SchoolDash, Hannay was the founding managing director of Digital Science in London, United Kingdom where he ran the company from its foundation in 2010 until 2015. Digital Science was founded to provide software and services aimed at scientific researchers and research administrators. Prior to Digital Science, he worked for Nature, which was owned by Macmillan Publishers until the merger of Springer and Macmillan to form Springer Nature in 2015.

response: DiBona runs Science Foo Camp annually with Tim O'Reilly of O'Reilly Media and Timo Hannay of Nature on the Google campus in Mountain View, California.

Previously Nature Publishing Group, Timo Hannay and Chris DiBona were also hosts and organisers. In 2021 the organizers of Sci Foo released a series of 5-minute lightning talks from alumni on YouTubehttps://www.youtube.com/channel/UCmaA8bQCHtQTrGJ0PAgASPw and a twelve-minute video made at SciFoo 2009 is also available.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=51YmoYxxwaQ
Timo Hannay's review in Nature said that in this book Nielsen gives "the most compelling and comprehensive case so far for a new approach to science in the Internet age".
*Timo Hannay (born 1968), English science writer and businessman
* From 2010 to 2015, Timo Hannay was Managing Director
